head.supplied: Fungi from near Melbourne sent to Kew ¶ Annotated top left [one illegible word] | 25/7/85.All names on the first sheet have a ✓ against them at the beginning of the name. Some have marks at the end of...

div.p: RB MSS M86B, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: The three foolscap sheets transcribed here are among a number sent by Cooke now in the library of the Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne. They have been associated by J. H. Willis with M. Cooke to M, 4 April 1885 (in this edition as 85-04-04b) but are dated here to 6 June 1885 on the basis that there is another item headed by Cooke 'Australian fungi since June 6, 1885', this also being consistent with the date '23/7/85' in M's annotations on each sheet. Because they were received together, they are treated as a single item. The sequence of the sheets is that arranged by Willis and is not necessarily the order in which they were assembled by Cooke.

seg.hi: Fungi from near Melbourne sent to Kew

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;
font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: All names on the first sheet have a ✓ against them at the beginning of the name. Some have marks at the end of the name; these are individually noted.

div.p:
Dacrymyces stillatus Fr
FNI attributes this name to Nees von Essenbeck, not Fries (accessed 2 April 2021).

Agaricus (Flammula) spumosus Fr
✓ converted to x after Fr.

Agaricus (Pleurotus) atro coeruleus Fr
✓ after Fr.

Agaricus (Leptonia) aethops Fr.
x after Fr.

Agaricus (Naucoria) conspersus Fr
x after Fr.

Agaricus (Collybia) radicatus Fr
x after Fr; FNI attributes this name to Relhan, not Fries (accessed 2 April 2021).

Clavaria flava var dichotoma Fr
Variety name not found (FNI and Index fungorum each accessed 2 April.

Agaricus (Stropharia) semiglobatus Fr
✓ after Fr; FNI attributes the name to Batsch, not Fries.

Agaricus (Mycena) galericulatus Fr
✓ after Fr; FNI attributes the name to Scopoli, not Fries.

Agaricus (Panaeolus) fimiputris Fr
✓ after Fr; FNI attributes the name to Bulliard, not Fries.

Irpex flavus Jungh
FNI attributes the name to Klotzsch, not Junghuhn.

Lycoperdon pusillum Fr
FNI attributes the name to Batsch, not Fries.

Ustilago utriculosa Fr
Index fungorum attributes the name to Tulasne & Tulasne, not Fries.

Agaricus (Clitocybe) infundibuliformis Fr
✓ converted to x after Fr; FNI attributes the name to Schaefer, not Fries.

Agaricus (Mycena) trachycephalus K
✓ converted to x after K; FNI attributes the name to Mueller & Kalchbrenner, not Kalchbrenner alone, see Kalchbrenner (1880), p. 151, dated June. The name had been published earlier, in B80.02.02, p. 89, with the same authorship.

Lycoperdon caelatum Fr
FNI attributes the name to Bulliard, not Fries.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: The single foolscap sheet with text on both sides is annotated by M: 'Rec | 23/7/85'. Unless otherwise noted, on this sheet there is a ✓ to the left of the name.

Port Denison Shann
William Shann. There is no ✓ against this name.

NSW. There is no ✓ against this name.

cell.p:
Moonan Carter
Henriette Carter, living at Moonan Brook, near Scone, NSW. There is no ✓ against this name.

cell.style: padding-left: 0.075in; padding-right: 0.075in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;

cell.p:
Clarendon
SA. Tepper
For M's report of receipt of this and other names of Tepper-numbered specimens, see M to O. Tepper, 25 July 1885 (in this edition as 85-07-25b). Note: some numbered names are not numbers of Tepper collections, for example the specimen numbered 9 below.

Now Gippsland, Vic. Stranger
Vic; Elijah Stranger. There is no ✓ against this name.

Upper Yarra Lucas
Vic. Probably Arthur H. S. Lucas or his brother Thomas P. Lucas; another possibility, Robert Lucas, collected for M mainly in the Otway Ranges.

Richmond River Hodgkinson
NSW. Probably Mary Hodgkinson, possibly her husband James Hodgkinson.

cell.style: padding-left: 0.075in; padding-right: 0.075in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
padding-left: 0.075in; padding-right: 0.075in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
cell.p:
Clavaria inaequalis Fr
FNI attributes the name to O. F. Müller, not Fries, although Index fungorum has Fries as the author of the combinations including varieties angustata, aurantiaca, fusiformis, and helvola.

cell.style: padding-left: 0.075in; padding-right: 0.075in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
cell.p:
Urara River Thornton
Now Orara River, NSW. Edith Thornton collected specimens for M in this area; see, for example, E. Thornton to M, 7 April 1884. See also Maroske & Vaughan (2014), p. 135.

cell.style: padding-left: 0.075in; padding-right: 0.075in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
padding-left: 0.075in; padding-right: 0.075in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
padding-left: 0.075in; padding-right: 0.075in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
cell.p:
Port Phillip (Watts)
Vic. Probably Henry Watts, who is known to have collected cryptogams; see H. Watts to M, 15 October 1883.

padding-left: 0.075in; padding-right: 0.075in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
cell.p:
Severn (Hartmann)
Qld; probably C. H. Hartmann.

There is no ✓ against this name.

FNI attributes the combination to De Notaris, but Index fungorum attributes a variety, multorum, to Tulasne &Tulasne.

Caliban River
Error for Coliban River? Near Kyneton, Vic.

Mossmanns Bay Whitelegge
Error for Mosman Bay, NSW, an area in which Thomas Whitelegge is known to have collected specimens?

Agaricus (Galera) tener Fr
FNI attributes A. tener to Schaeffer, but there is a species A. tenax attributed to Fries.

Moe Gippsland
The text ends about one-third of the way down the page; there is no signature. What follows is on a separate sheet.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: The top left of the sheet is annotated by M 'Rec | 23/7/85'. The layout of the sheet is not all in the semi-tabulated form of the previous one, but the transcription is structured to preserve the logical relationships within the entries. The text occupies about one half of one side of a foolscap page, and ends without signature.

cell.p:
Conidial form pf Cordyceps on Melolontha larva?
Melolontha is a genus of beetles.
